title: RankCoT: Refining Knowledge for Retrieval-Augmented Generation through Ranking Chain-of-Thoughts
author: Mingyan Wu (Northeastern University), Zhenghao Liu (Northeastern University), Yukun Yan (Institute for AI, Tsinghua University), Xinze Li (Northeastern University), Shi Yu (Institute for AI, Tsinghua University), Zheni Zeng (Institute for AI, Tsinghua University), Yu Gu (Northeastern University), Ge Yu (Northeastern University)
relevance_why: The techniques proposed in this paper for knowledge refinement through ranking and summarization can be adapted for improving audio-generation tasks, particularly in refining context information for text-to-audio generation.
background: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) uses external knowledge to improve the performance of language models, but often struggles with irrelevant information from retrieved documents.
contribution: RankCoT introduces a knowledge refinement method that combines reranking and Chain-of-Thought (CoT) summarization to enhance the accuracy of responses generated by language models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing RAG models rely on either reranking or summarization separately, which can allow noise from irrelevant documents to mislead responses.
technical_comparison.novelty: RankCoT integrates both processes into a unified framework, allowing for more coherent use of retrieved knowledge and better alignment with the query.

key_innovation: The integration of a self-reflection mechanism that allows the model to further refine its outputs, minimizing overfitting to undesired response patterns.
real_world_impact: Enhancing RAG models can significantly improve applications such as question answering and information retrieval, ultimately leading to more reliable AI assistants and automated systems in information-rich domains.
limitations: The model's effectiveness is still contingent on the underlying capabilities of the language models used for training, which may vary.

new_terms.Chain-of-Thought (CoT): **Chain-of-Thought** refers to a reasoning prompt style used to support the logical flow of explanations or justifications in AI model outputs.
new_terms.Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): **Retrieval-Augmented Generation** is an approach that enhances the output of language models by incorporating external information retrieved from a knowledge base.

open_sourcing: All code and data are available at https://github.com/NEUIR/RankCoT.
